WorkItem.Description:
Reforge/enchant/gem-only optimize on frost mages seem to be a bit wonky. No matter what I seem to do, it will always optimize to a DPS decrease. The attached file is myself, US-Stormrage Kuni, on the default fight settings of a fresh download, telling it to optimize at the highest setting. I get similar results when trying to model my guild's last Baleroc kill as close as I can. From what I can see, it seems that the formulation isn't valuing pre-4pT12 mastery as high as it should be, as every result seems to be mastery -> haste.
 
I'm unsure if the optimizer is just required to change something, because there's no other reason it should give a lower DPS result than what it started with.
 
As a side note, the default frost build is out of date. It should be 2 in netherwind presence insetad of 2 in arcane concentration.

Comments.Message: I'm going to vouch for Kuni in that the damage does go down, I loaded her toon in and only did a few minor changes to the options (length of fight, remove 2T10 Evocation and Mana Potion as options) and I came up with a lower DPS value after the optimization
Here is my Frost build that I've been keeping up since almost the start of 4.2

Go to Tinkering chart and mark Synapse Springs as available. We'll have to fix the detection for this, I don't think we extended it to tinkerings like we have for gems/enchants that warns you when you forget to mark something available.

Success! +0.28%. I can't believe I overlooked that. Some of the numbers still look a bit odd in places, but this is a lot better. Thank you for that, and I hope detection is fixed along with default frost spec.
